required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Investigation of Acute Effects of Action Observation Training on Upper Extremity Functionality, Reaction Time and Cognitive Functions in Right-handed Healthy Subjects
clinical_study.official_title: The Investigation of Acute Effects of Action Observation Training on Upper Extremity Functionality, Reaction Time and Cognitive Functions in Right-handed Healthy Subjects

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of the study is to investigate the acute effects of action observation training on upper extremity functionality, reaction times, and cognitive functions in right-handed healthy subjects.

primary_outcome.time_frame: The outcome will be assessed at baseline and immediately after the intervention.
primary_outcome.description: Jebsen-Taylor Hand Function Test will be used

primary_outcome.time_frame: The outcome will be assessed at baseline and immediately after the intervention.
primary_outcome.description: Nine-Hole Peg Test will be used.

primary_outcome.time_frame: The outcome will be assessed at baseline and immediately after the intervention.
primary_outcome.description: Serial Reaction Time Task will be used.

primary_outcome.time_frame: The outcome will be assessed at baseline and immediately after the intervention.
primary_outcome.description: d2 Test of Attention will be used.

primary_outcome.time_frame: The outcome will be assessed at baseline and immediately after the intervention.
primary_outcome.description: Ruler drop test will be used.

arm_group.description: Participants will watch their own actions during an upper extremity functionality test.
Participants will watch a person while performing an upper extremity functionality test.
Participants will perform an upper extremity task 4 more times.
Participants will watch a slide show which will only contain landscapes.
Participants will wait without any performance till the second assesment.

intervention.description: Action observation training is a relatively new rehabilitation approach in which the subject is asked to carefully observe the actions presented through a video clip or performed by an operator.
Participants perform an upper extremity functionality test a couple of times.
Participants will watch a slide show of landscape

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- >18 years old
- willingness
Exclusion Criteria:
- any kind of neurological or musculoskeletal problems
- sight problems
- pain in the upper limb
- left handedness
